title: Sonnet 18
description: Sonnet 18 — William Shakespeare
content:
## Original (English)
Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate:
Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,
And summer's lease hath all too short a date:
Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines,
And often is his gold complexion dimm'd;
And every fair from fair sometime declines,
By chance or nature's changing course untrimm'd;
But thy eternal summer shall not fade
Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow'st;
Nor shall Death brag thou wander'st in his shade,
When in eternal lines to time thou grow'st:
So long as men can breathe or eyes can see,
So long lives this and this gives life to thee.

## 中文译文
我可否把你比作仲夏日？
你却更可爱、更温和：
狂风摇落了五月可爱的花蕾，
夏的租期亦太短暂；
有时天空之眼过于炽热，
又常让它的金面变得暗淡；
每一美好终将因偶然或自然改换而失色；
但你的永恒之夏不会凋谢，
也不会失去你所拥有的光彩；
死亡也不能夸耀你游走在其阴影下，
因你在不朽诗行中向时光生长：
只要人们能呼吸、眼睛能看见，
这诗便长存，且将你赋予生命。

## 赏析
莎士比亚十四行诗中最著名的一首，借仲夏喻美，最后把永恒托付给诗句，表达对所爱之人永恒不朽的赞美。

title: I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud
description: Daffodils — William Wordsworth
content:
## Original (English)
I wandered lonely as a cloud
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
A host, of golden daffodils;
Beside the lake, beneath the trees,
Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.

For oft, when on my couch I lie
In vacant or in pensive mood,
They flash upon that inward eye
Which is the bliss of solitude;
And then my heart with pleasure fills,
And dances with the daffodils.

## 中文译文
我像一朵孤云漂荡，
高悬山谷与丘岭之上；
忽然我看见一群、成群的
金黄水仙；
在湖旁、树下，
随风摇曳起舞。

常当我闲卧沉思时，
这些画面闪入我内心之眼，
那是独处的喜悦；
我的心随之充盈欢愉，
与水仙共舞。

## 赏析
浪漫主义代表作，借自然景象抒发诗人心境：自然的美给予孤独心灵以慰藉与欢欣。

title: The Tyger
description: The Tyger — William Blake
content:
## Original (English)
Tyger Tyger, burning bright,
In the forests of the night;
What immortal hand or eye,
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?

In what distant deeps or skies.
Burnt the fire of thine eyes?
On what wings dare he aspire?
What the hand, dare seize the fire?

## 中文译文
虎啊虎，燃烧般明亮，
夜林之中闪耀；
何等不朽之手与之目，
能造就你这可畏的对称？

在何处深渊或苍穹，
燃起你那双眼的火？
他凭何等之翼敢于企及？
何等之手敢握住火焰？

## 赏析
布莱克以质问式的语调探讨创造者与被造物的奥秘，寓意善恶并存与宇宙创造的震撼。

title: Ozymandias
description: Ozymandias — Percy Bysshe Shelley
content:
## Original (English)
I met a traveller from an antique land,
Who said—“Two vast and trunkless legs of stone
Stand in the desert. . . . Near them, on the sand,
Half sunk a shattered visage lies, whose frown,
And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command,
Tell that its sculptor well those passions read
Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things,
The hand that mocked them, and the heart that fed;
And on the pedestal, these words appear:
My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings;
Look on my Works, ye Mighty, and despair!
Nothing beside remains. Round the decay
Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare
The lone and level sands stretch far away.”

## 中文译文
我遇见一位来自古地的旅行者，
他说：两只巨大无躯的石腿
立在沙漠……近旁，半没于沙中的
破碎面容躺着，眉愁唇皱，冷傲的讥笑，
显示雕像者深谙那激情——
这激情仍在这些无生命之物上留存。
戏谑它们的手，与哺育它们的心；
座碑上刻着这样的字眼：
“我名为奥兹曼迪亚斯，万王之王；
列王啊，看我之功，灰心吧！”
再无别物。荒凉中，残骸周围
无垠平坦之沙伸展到天边。

## 赏析
讽刺权力与骄傲的短诗：一切人类成就终将湮没于时光，唯有荒沙见证过往。

title: To Autumn
description: To Autumn — John Keats
content:
## Original (English)
Season of mists and mellow fruitfulness,
Close bosom-friend of the maturing sun;
Conspiring with him how to load and bless
With fruit the vines that round the thatch-eves run;
To bend with apples the moss'd cottage-trees,
And fill all fruit with ripeness to the core;
To swell the gourd, and plump the hazel shells
With a sweet kernel; to set budding more,
And still more, later flowers for the bees,
Until they think warm days will never cease,
For Summer has o'er-brimm'd their clammy cells.

## 中文译文
迷雾与馨果之季，
成熟太阳之密友；
与之共谋使藤蔓满载恩赐，
把茅屋檐下的葡萄压弯；
让苹果弯下长满青苔的庭树，
把一切果实填满至核；
膨胀葫芦，饱满榛果的壳，
为蜜蜂再开更多花朵，
直到它们以为暖日永不止息，
因为夏已溢满它们潮湿的巢室。

## 赏析
对秋日丰盈景象的颂歌，细腻地描绘成熟、丰饶与季节更迭的美学。

title: Annabel Lee
description: Annabel Lee — Edgar Allan Poe
content:
## Original (English)
It was many and many a year ago,
In a kingdom by the sea,
That a maiden there lived whom you may know
By the name of Annabel Lee;
And this maiden she lived with no other thought
Than to love and be loved by me.

We loved with a love that was more than love—
I and my Annabel Lee—
With a love that the winged seraphs of Heaven
Coveted her and me.

## 中文译文
多年前多年以前，
在一海边王国，
住着一名少女，你或许知她姓名——
安娜贝尔·李；
她的心思不过一件：
爱我并被我所爱。

我们相爱，比爱情更深——
我和我的安娜贝尔·李——
连天堂带翼的炽天使，
也嫉妒她与我。

## 赏析
坡以童话般的语调写出凄美之爱，死亡无法摧毁诗人对挚爱的缅怀与执着。

title: Invictus
description: Invictus — William Ernest Henley
content:
## Original (English)
Out of the night that covers me,
Black as the pit from pole to pole,
I thank whatever gods may be
For my unconquerable soul.
In the fell clutch of circumstance
I have not winced nor cried aloud.
Under the bludgeonings of chance
My head is bloody, but unbowed.

## 中文译文
从遮盖我的黑夜中，
如极地至极地的深渊一般，
我感谢或许存在的诸神，
赐我这不屈不挠的灵魂。
在命运凶狠的掌握中，
我未曾退缩或高声哀叫。
在机遇的重击下，
头虽血流仍不低首。

## 赏析
短诗以刚毅之语颂扬不屈的精神，常被引为逆境中自强不息的象征。

title: She Walks in Beauty
description: She Walks in Beauty — Lord Byron
content:
## Original (English)
She walks in beauty, like the night
Of cloudless climes and starry skies;
And all that's best of dark and bright
Meet in her aspect and her eyes;
Thus mellowed to that tender light
Which heaven to gaudy day denies.

## 中文译文
她行于美中，如夜之美，
无云气候、星辰苍穹；
黑与亮之精华，
汇于她的容颜与眼眸；
柔和成那温柔之光，
是天不予喧嚣昼日的恩赐。

## 赏析
拜伦以夜与光暗的对照来描写女性的温柔与神秘，是浪漫主义描摹美的典范。

title: A Dream Within a Dream
description: A Dream Within a Dream — Edgar Allan Poe
content:
## Original (English)
Take this kiss upon the brow!
And, in parting from you now,
Thus much let me avow —
You are not wrong, who deem
That my days have been a dream;
Yet if hope has flown away
In a night, or in a day,
In a vision, or in none,
Is it therefore the less gone?
All that we see or seem
Is but a dream within a dream.

## 中文译文
让我于额上赐此吻！
如今与君别去，
容我坦白：
若你以为我之日子如梦，
你并非错觉；
即便希望在夜或白昼、
在幻象或虚无中飞逝，
它是否因此就少了呢？
我们所见与所似，
不过梦中之梦。

## 赏析
坡在存在与虚幻之间追问真实，结尾的感叹带有深沉的虚无美学。

title: Because I could not stop for Death
description: Because I could not stop for Death — Emily Dickinson
content:
## Original (English)
Because I could not stop for Death —
He kindly stopped for me —
The Carriage held but just Ourselves —
And Immortality.

We slowly drove — He knew no haste
And I had put away
My labor and my leisure too,
For His Civility —

## 中文译文
因我不能为死驻足——
死亡便仁慈地驻车等我——
马车只容我们二人——
以及不朽。

我们缓缓行驶——他不知匆忙；
我已收起劳作与闲暇，
为了他的礼遇——

## 赏析
狄金森以冷静的笔触拟人化死亡，把死亡描画为一位有礼的骑士，反映对生命终结的平静与哲思。

title: Hope is the thing with feathers
description: Hope is the thing with feathers — Emily Dickinson
content:
## Original (English)
“Hope” is the thing with feathers —
That perches in the soul —
And sings the tune without the words —
And never stops — at all —

And sweetest — in the Gale — is heard —
And sore must be the storm — that could abash the little Bird
That kept so many warm —

## 中文译文
“希望”是带羽之物——
栖于心灵之上——
无词却唱着曲——
并且从不止息——

风暴中它声更甜美——
必是更烈之暴风能令此小鸟屈服——
它曾给无数人以温暖——

## 赏析
狄金森以简洁比喻描绘希望的恒久与温柔，即使逆境也难以摧折。

title: My Heart Leaps Up
description: My Heart Leaps Up — William Wordsworth
content:
## Original (English)
My heart leaps up when I behold
A rainbow in the sky:
So was it when my life began;
So is it now I am a man;
So be it when I shall grow old,
Or let me die!

## 中文译文
当我仰望天际彩虹，
我心雀跃：
生我之初如此；
如今已为人亦如此；
愿我老去时仍然如此，
否则宁死！

## 赏析
短小精悍，抒发诗人对自然连续性的敬爱，强调童年感悟贯穿一生的重要性。

title: The Lake Isle of Innisfree
description: The Lake Isle of Innisfree — W. B. Yeats
content:
## Original (English)
I will arise and go now, and go to Innisfree,
And a small cabin build there, of clay and wattles made;
Nine bean-rows will I have there, a hive for the honey-bee,
And live alone in the bee-loud glade.

And I shall have some peace there, for peace comes dropping slow,
Dropping from the veils of the morning to where the cricket sings;
There midnight's all a glimmer, and noon a purple glow,
And evening full of the linnet's wings.

## 中文译文
我将起身前往伊尼斯弗，
筑一小屋以泥与柳条；
那里我将有九行豆畦，一蜂箱，
独居在蜂鸣的林间空地。

我将在彼处得些许宁静，宁静缓缓降临，
从晨雾垂落至蟋蟀鸣处；
半夜泛着微光，正午如紫色光晕，
夜幕满是林妮特鸟翅的低语。

## 赏析
叶芝写对田园宁静的向往，诗语简洁而富音乐性，营造出避世的理想画面。

title: La Belle Dame sans Merci
description: La Belle Dame sans Merci — John Keats
content:
## Original (English)
O what can ail thee, knight-at-arms,
Alone and palely loitering?
The sedge has wither'd from the lake,
And no birds sing.

I met a lady in the meads,
Full beautiful—a faery's child,
Her hair was long, her foot was light,
And her eyes were wild.

## 中文译文
铠甲骑士啊，何以病恹恹，
独自徘徊，面色苍白？
芦苇自湖边枯萎，
鸟儿亦已绝唱。

我在草地遇见一位女子，
甚美——如仙女之子，
长发，轻步，眼神狂野。

## 赏析
一首带有民谣色彩的叙诗，讲述骑士被美丽却致命的女子迷惑后的荒凉结局，隐含爱与毁灭的双重意味。

title: Sonnet 116
description: Sonnet 116 — William Shakespeare
content:
## Original (English)
Let me not to the marriage of true minds
Admit impediments. Love is not love
Which alters when it alteration finds,
Or bends with the remover to remove:
O no; it is an ever-fixed mark
That looks on tempests and is never shaken;
It is the star to every wand'ring bark,
Whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken.

## 中文译文
愿我不阻挡真心契合的结合：
真爱不是在发现变易时改变，
也非随迁移而迁移；
不，真爱是恒定的标志，
俯瞰风暴而不动摇；
是航船的指引之星，
其价值难测，纵可度其高度。

## 赏析
莎士比亚对真爱的经典定义：坚定、不屈、超越时间与试炼。

title: O Captain! My Captain!
description: O Captain! My Captain! — Walt Whitman
content:
## Original (English)
O Captain! my Captain! our fearful trip is done,
The ship has weather'd every rack, the prize we sought is won,
The port is near, the bells I hear, the people all exulting,
While follow eyes the steady keel, the vessel grim and daring;
But O heart! heart! heart!
O the bleeding drops of red,
Where on the deck my Captain lies,
Fallen cold and dead.

## 中文译文
哦，船长！我的船长！我们惊心动魄的航程已毕，
船已安然越过风暴，我们所求之赏得以夺回，
港口近在眼前，钟声可闻，人群欢腾，
凝望那坚定之龙骨，英勇之船；
然心呐！心呐！血滴纷飞，
甲板之上我的船长伏倒，
冷而已亡。

## 赏析
惠特曼以悼亡之歌纪念林肯式的英雄，悲壮而充满对领导者牺牲的缅怀。

title: Dover Beach (excerpt)
description: Dover Beach — Matthew Arnold
content:
## Original (English)
The sea is calm to-night.
The tide is full, the moon lies fair
Upon the straits; on the French coast the light
Gleams and is gone; the cliffs of England stand,
Glimmering and vast, out in the tranquil bay.

Listen! you hear the grating roar
Of pebbles which the waves draw back, and fling,
At their return, up the high strand,
Begin, and cease, and then again begin,
With tremulous cadence slow, and bring
The eternal note of sadness in.

## 中文译文
今夜大海平静，
潮盈月明照海峡；
法岸的灯光闪过即逝，
英格兰峭壁在宁湾中微光苍茫。

听啊！那礁石摩擦的轰鸣，
浪退又卷起卵石，抛向高岸，
起始、止息、再起，
以颤动迟缓的节拍，
带来永恒的悲哀之音。

## 赏析
阿诺德借海景抒发时代的信仰危机与孤独感，结尾常被解读为对信念丧失的哀思。

title: To My Mother (excerpt)
description: To My Mother — Christina Rossetti
content:
## Original (English)
Mother, I sometimes think
That I shall never see
The small white cloud, the wave at play —
The little honey-bee —

And yet I hope for many things,
And when I have no hopes at all,
I hide beneath my bed and cry
And think of childish things.

## 中文译文
母亲，我时常想，
或许我再不会见到
那小白云，嬉戏的波光——
那只小蜜蜂——

然而我仍期盼诸多，
即便全然无望时，
我伏于床下哭泣，
思绪回到孩提时光。

## 赏析
罗塞蒂以温柔朴实的语调描写对母亲与童年简单事物的眷恋与脆弱感。

title: When I Have Fears
description: When I Have Fears — John Keats
content:
## Original (English)
When I have fears that I may cease to be
Before my pen has glean'd my teeming brain,
Before high-pil'd books, in charact'ry, hold
The full ripen'd grain; when I behold, upon the night,
Huge cloudy symbols of a high romance,
And think that I may never live to trace their shadows, with the magic hand,
And when I feel, fair creature of an hour!
That I shall never look upon thee more,
Never have relish in the faery power
Of unreflecting love;—then on the shore
Of the wide world I stand alone, and think
Till love and fame to nothingness do sink.

## 中文译文
当我恐惧自己将消逝，
在我的笔收割我富饶之脑之前，
在高堆的书籍以文字
收藏那成熟的谷粒之前；
当我望见夜间巨大的云象，
那高远浪漫的象征，
却又恐我未能以魔法之手描绘其影；
当我感到，转瞬之美人啊，
我或许再也不能注视你，
再不能品尝那未设防的爱情之力；
于是我立于广袤世界之岸，独自深思，
直到爱与名声归于虚无。

## 赏析
浓烈的存在焦虑与对未竟创造的哀叹，说明写作者在有限生命面前对创作与爱情的双重渴望。

title: A Red, Red Rose
description: A Red, Red Rose — Robert Burns
content:
## Original (English)
O my Luve is like a red, red rose
That's newly sprung in June;
O my Luve is like the melody
That's sweetly played in tune.

As fair art thou, my bonnie lass,
So deep in luve am I;
And I will luve thee still, my dear,
Till a' the seas gang dry.

## 中文译文
我之爱如红红玫瑰，
六月新绽；
我之爱如美妙旋律，
和谐而甜美。

你如此美丽，我可爱姑娘，
我深陷爱河；
我将永爱你，亲爱之人，
直至海水干涸。

## 赏析
朴素而真挚的誓言诗，用自然意象和夸张修辞表达誓死不渝的爱情。

title: The Thread of Your Light
description: The Thread of Your Light — Eleanor Wren
content:
## Original (English)
Your light runs through the dark like a thread of gold,
Binding the scattered pieces of my wandering soul.
With every breath, you gather what I lose,
And teach my trembling hands to hold again.

## 中文译文
你的光如金线穿过黑暗，
缝合我灵魂里散落的碎片。
每一次呼吸，你拾起我遗失的一切，
教会我颤抖的双手再次握紧。

## 赏析
诗歌以“金线”象征爱给予的力量，使破碎得以重生。

title: Until the Quiet Answers
description: Until the Quiet Answers — Rowan Hale
content:
## Original (English)
I wait with you until the quiet answers,
Until the restless hours drift into dawn.
Your heartbeat is the map I follow home,
When all the world has turned its face away.

## 中文译文
我与你一同等待沉默的回答，
直到不安的时辰沉入黎明。
你的心跳是我回家的路图，
在全世界转身离开的时刻。

## 赏析
诗歌通过“安静的回答”象征困境后的理解，展现出陪伴的温柔力量。

title: Where Our Shadows Meet
description: Where Our Shadows Meet — Celia Thorn
content:
## Original (English)
Where your shadow meets mine,
A softer world rises from the earth.
There, grief learns to fold its wings,
And time forgets to wound.

## 中文译文
在你的影子与我相遇之处，
一个更柔软的世界从地面升起。
在那里，悲伤学会收起翅膀，
时间也忘了继续伤人。

## 赏析
诗歌以影子会合为隐喻，表达两人共同创造的安全与治愈之地。

title: The Distance Inside My Name
description: The Distance Inside My Name — Livia Maren
content:
## Original (English)
You speak my name and shorten the distance
Between who I was and who I become.
Your voice carries the dawn like a vessel,
Pouring light into my unanswered parts.

## 中文译文
你呼唤我的名字，缩短了距离，
让我在过去与未来之间靠近自己。
你的声音如承载黎明的容器，
把光倒入我尚未回应的深处。

## 赏析
诗中“名字”的象征强调身份与亲密的力量，让人与自我重新连结。

title: A Sky That Knows Your Shape
description: A Sky That Knows Your Shape — Mira Leighton
content:
## Original (English)
Above us spreads a sky that knows your shape,
A quiet witness to the places you have healed.
Even the wind slows down to listen
When your laughter lifts the day.

## 中文译文
头顶的天空熟知你的形状，
默默见证你治愈过的所有地方。
当你的笑声托起白昼，
连风都放慢脚步倾听。

## 赏析
诗歌以“天空”为永恒意象，使爱与治愈的力量显得广阔深远。

title: The Silence Between Heartbeats
description: The Silence Between Heartbeats — Adrian Vale
content:
## Original (English)
In the silence between heartbeats,
Your presence gathers like soft rain.
Even without words, you answer me,
Teaching my fear to breathe.

## 中文译文
在心跳之间的沉寂里，
你的存在如轻雨聚集。
即便无言，你已回应了我，
教会我的恐惧重新呼吸。

## 赏析
诗歌以极其细腻的意象展现无声的理解与陪伴，是温柔关系的象征。

title: A Lantern Made of Your Hands
description: A Lantern Made of Your Hands — Selene Adair
content:
## Original (English)
Your hands shape a lantern out of my darkness,
Lifting what I cannot name.
With you, even the smallest hope
Learns how to shine.

## 中文译文
你的双手在我的黑暗中做成灯笼，
托起那些我无法命名的事物。
与你在一起，哪怕最小的希望，
也学会了发光。

## 赏析
诗通过“灯笼”象征爱给予方向与温暖，让微小的希望得以点亮。

title: Where Your Voice Rests
description: Where Your Voice Rests — Isla Harrow
content:
## Original (English)
Your voice rests in the hollow of my chest,
A quiet ember warming the hours.
Whenever I forget the shape of peace,
You speak, and it returns.

## 中文译文
你的声音在我胸腔的弧度里停歇，
像余烬般温暖着所有时刻。
每当我忘记平静的模样，
你说话，它便归来。

## 赏析
诗中“余烬”的形象温柔细腻，象征语言带来的安抚与归属。

title: The Door You Open in Me
description: The Door You Open in Me — Emery Lark
content:
## Original (English)
There is a door in me only you can open,
A room of quiet light untouched by sorrow.
Your footsteps awaken its sleeping walls
And turn the years gentle again.

## 中文译文
在我心里有一扇唯你能开的门，
里面是未被悲伤触碰的静光。
你的脚步唤醒沉睡的墙壁，
让岁月再次变得温柔。

## 赏析
诗歌以“门”与“房间”象征心灵深处最柔软的区域，表达独一无二的信任感。

title: I Carry Your Morning
description: I Carry Your Morning — Aiden Glade
content:
## Original (English)
I carry your morning with me,
Even when night gathers around my steps.
Your hope is stitched into my breath,
A promise that light remembers my name.

## 中文译文
我随身携带着你的清晨，
即使黑夜围绕着我的脚步。
你的希望缝进我的呼吸里，
承诺着光从未忘记我的名字。

## 赏析
诗歌以“携带清晨”展现爱的力量穿透黑暗，象征被照亮的生命状态。
